[[MTV Southeast Asia|MTV]] | web = [http://www.nick-asia.com Nickelodeon SEA Homepage] | sat serv 1 = [[TVB Pay Vision]] (Hong Kong) | sat chan 1 = Channel 302 | sat serv 2 = [[Astro (satellite TV)|Astro]] (Malaysia) | sat chan 2 = Channel 612 (SD)
Channel 632 (HD) (Coming soon) | sat serv 3 = [[Indovision]] (Indonesia) | sat chan 3 = Channel 49 | sat serv 4 = [[Astro Nusantara]] (Indonesia) | sat chan 4 = Channel 14 | sat serv 5 = [[TelkomVision]] (Indonesia) | sat chan 5 = Channel 33 | sat serv 6 = [[TrueVisions]] (Thailand) | sat chan 6 = Channel 33 | sat serv 7 = [[DishHD]] (Taiwan) | sat chan 7 = Channel 6565 | cable serv 1 = [[StarHub TV]] (Singapore) | cable chan 1 = Channel 314 | cable serv 2 = [[First Media]] (Indonesia) | cable chan 2 = Channel 125 | cable serv 3 = [[TelkomVision]] (Indonesia) | cable chan 3 = Channel 33 | cable serv 4 = [[TrueVisions]] (Thailand) | cable chan 4 = Channel 33 | cable serv 5 = [[Cable TV Hong Kong]] (Hong Kong) | cable chan 5 = Channel 139 | cable serv 6 = [[MediaNet]] (Maldives) | cable chan 6 = Channel 208 | adsl serv 1 = [[now TV]] (Hong Kong) | adsl chan 1 = Channel 444 | adsl serv 2 = [[IndosatM2]] (Indonesia) | adsl chan 2 = Channel 224 | adsl serv 3 = [[UniFi]] (Malaysia) | adsl chan 3 = Channel 136 }} '''Nickelodeon Southeast Asia''' is a [[Satellite television|satellite]] and [[Cable television|cable]] [[Television Channel|TV channel]] for [[child]]ren and [[Adolescence|teenager]]s. Operated by [[MTV Networks Asia Pacific]] and owned by [[Viacom International]]. In October 11, 2006, [[Viacom]]'s subsidiary [[MTV Networks Asia Pacific]] set up a new unit to manage Nickelodeon's southeast Asia operations.[http://www.viacom.com/view_release.jhtml;jsessionid=APLJH3MQVAW1CCQBAFLA4CY?inID=10000007&inReleaseID=227417 "MTV Networks Asia Pacific Announces A New Structure To Advance Its Localization Strategy"], Viacom, 11 October 2006[http://www.nick.com/all_nick/everything_nick/intl_home.jhtml Nick Asia & World History] In April 1, 2011, [[Nickelodeon Philippines]] left the South East Asia feed and redirected broadcast to their new independent feed.[http://www.philstar.com/Article.aspx?articleId=650212&publicationSubCategoryId=85 Nickelodeon launches dedicated channel to Filipino Kids] Three different networks exist for the market; one for [[southeast Asia]] in general which features [[Malay language|Malay]], [[Mandarin language|Mandarin]] and [[Thai language|Thai]]-language soundtracks (along with the original [[English language|English]]) and transmits in the [[PAL]] format, a [[The Philippines|Filipino]] [[NTSC]] channel, and a third network for [[Indonesia]]. ==History== [[File:Nickelodeon logo.svg|thumb|left|150px|Nick logo used November 6, 1998 to February 12, 2010 in Asia.]] In November 1998, Nickelodeon decided to reach the popular channel to the [[Philippines]], [[Japan]] & [[Russia]] as an attempt to bring the popular channel to Asia. In 2003, it became a part of Nicksplat (Nickelodeon's headquarters in Asia). In October 11, 2006, [[Viacom]]'s subsidiary [[MTV Networks]] Asia Pacific set up a new unit to manage [[Nickelodeon South East Asia]] TV based in [[Singapore]].[http://www.viacom.com/view_release.jhtml;jsessionid=APLJH3MQVAW1CCQBAFLA4CY?inID=10000007&inReleaseID=227417 "MTV Networks Asia Pacific Announces A New Structure To Advance Its Localization Strategy"], Viacom, 11 October 2006 Nickelodeon was launched in [[Singapore]] and expanded its services in [[Southeast Asia]], [[South Asia]], and [[Polynesia]]. In the present, Nickelodeon [[Philippines]] , Nickelodeon [[Pakistan]], and Nickelodeon [[India]] started working independently. They started their new website, [http://www.nicksplat.com Nicksplat.com] in 2003. In March 15, 2010, Nickelodeon revamped their logo same as the [[United States]] and worldwide and started broadcasting newer Nickelodeon shows from the United States that represents the new Nickelodeon logo and airs latest episodes of current Nick shows. In April 1, 2011, the Nickelodeon channel in the [[Philippines]] was replaced with a dedicated Filipino feed. In April 11, 2011, the lineup was changed prior to Nickelodeon Southeast Asia. The new schedule will put live-action programs in the primetime slot and will double the [[Nick Jr.]] block. On July 1, 2011, the Nick Jr. block on the South East Asia feed was removed. This is because the current [[Nick Jr. (South East Asia)|Nick. Jr]] channel which launched in [[Singapore|Singapore's]] [[StarHub TV]] on May 18, 2011 was rated the number one channel for the highest average time spent to watch the channel by kids aged 4 to 14 for the first quarter of 2011 in Singapore. Due to the increasing preschool audience, there is also an increasing demand for a 24-hour preschool channel, therefore causing the removal of the block. The new Nick Jr. channel is available in South east asia .[http://www.nick-asia.com/nickjr/faq.php Nick. Jr Frequently Asked Questions] ==Other channels== ===Nick Jr.=== {{Main|Nick Jr. (South East Asia)}} Nick Jr. is the preschool channel which replaced the Nick Jr. block on Nickelodeon's main South East Asia feed since July 1, 2011. It was launched on May 18, 2011 on [[StarHub TV]] Channel 304 in [[Singapore]] and on [[TelkomVision]] Channel 305 in [[Indonesia]]. The channel will expand it's broadcast to other parts of South East Asia later this year (2011).[http://www.nick-asia.com/nickjr/faq.php Nick Jr. Frequently Asked Questions] ==Kids Choice Awards in Asia== ===Kids Choice Awards Indonesia=== The '''Indonesia Kids Choice Awards''' is the first Kids Choice Awards set in [[Asia]] next to the [[Philippines]]. The first show was held since 2008 in [[Jakarta]] and was first hosted by [[Tora Sudiro]], [[Tasya Kamila]] and [[Ringgo Agus Rahman]] and some various Indonesian Artist's over the years. The logo of the show is exactly the same as the US version however, it is designed for the Indonesian version of the show and still read Nickelodeon Indonesia Kids Choice Awards. ===Philippines Kids Choice Awards=== {{Main|Nickelodeon Philippines Kids' Choice Awards}} The '''Philippines Kids Choice Awards''' is the second setting of the Kids Choice Awards in Asia preceded by [[Indonesia]]. The show was first held since 2008 in the Aliw Theater, [[Pasay City]] and was first hosted by [[Michael V.]] and some various [[Filipino people|Filipino]] artists.According to Amit Jain, executive Vice-President and managing director of [[MTV Networks]] India, China and Southeast Asia, "This is a milestone for Nickelodeon's business in Southeast Asia as it will deliver on Nick's commitment of providing global kids-centric shows and properties which are adapted to reflect local tastes and aspirations." [http://www.worldscreen.com/newscurrent.php?filename=kidschoice11248.htm, Kids' Choice Awards Set for Indonesia, Philippines] The Philippines KCA has been inactive all over the years. ==Availability== ===Singapore=== * Nickelodeon is available on [[StarHub TV]] Channel 314. It is an English primary audio channel, dub in [[Chinese language|Mandarin]] on secondary audio channel. However this only applies to animated programs like [[Fairly Oddparents]]. ===Indonesia=== {{Main|Nickelodeon Indonesia}} * Nickelodeon is available on [[First Media]] Channel 125, [[Indovision]] Channel 49, [[TelkomVision]] and [[IndosatM2]] and [[Aora TV]] Channel 33. * Originally broadcast on free-to-air television on [[ANTV]] then moved to [[Trans7]] in [[2002]] then "Nick on [[Lativi]]" (now [[TV ONE (Indonesia)|TV One]]), and was subsequently moved to "Nick di [[Global TV (Indonesia)|Global TV]]". ===Philippines=== {{Main|Nickelodeon Philippines}} ===Malaysia=== * Nickelodeon is available on [[Astro (satellite TV)|Astro]] Channel 612. English primary audio channel, dub in [[Malay language|Malay]] on secondary audio channel. In 2008, a third audio channel, [[Mandarin Chinese|Mandarin]], was added. However the Malay and Mandarin audio channels are only available on selected programming blocks. Attempts to access them on blocks where they're not transmitted yields the English primary audio channel. Due to an agreement between Viacom and Astro, Nickelodeon Asia cannot appear on other pay TV networks in Malaysia. * Many of Nickelodeon's Programming are also available on free-to-air channel [[TV9 (Malaysia)|TV9]], albeit dubbed into Malay with the original English language track lost, as part of its Nickelodeon block, called [[List_of_programmes_broadcast_by_TV9_(Malaysia)#Children.27s_Block|Nick di 9]]. More popular programs are also aired with their original English soundtrack on [[TV3 (Malaysia)|TV3]] and over [[NTV7 (Malaysia)|NTV7]]. ===Taiwan=== {{Main|Nickelodeon Taiwan}} * Nickelodeon is available on [[Chunghwa Telecom]]'s MOD channel 22. * Many of Nickelodeon's Programming are also available on [[ETTV Yoyo]]. ===Thailand=== * Nickelodeon is available on [[TrueVisions]] for both satellite and cable on TV with Thai language soundtrack. ===Hong Kong=== * Nickelodeon is available on [[Now TV]] Channel 444, [[Cable TV Hong Kong]] Channel 139, [[TVB Pay Vision]] and [[HKBN bbTV]] Channel 302. ===Vietnam=== * Nickelodeon is available in Vietnam on [[SCTV]] and [[Vietbao Cable TV]] Channel 41.http://en.academic.ru/dic.nsf/enwiki/4247292" ==Programming== {{Main|List of Nickelodeon South East Asia Shows}} On March 2010, Nickelodeon Southeast Asia started airing latest [[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] shows and episodes from the [[United States]]. ''[[The Troop]]'', ''[[Team Umizoomi]]'', ''[[Fanboy and Chum Chum]]'' and ''[[Big Time Rush]]'' are its first shows that represents the new Nickelodeon logo while ''[[SpongeBob SquarePants]]'', ''[[iCarly]]'', ''[[Penguins of Madagascar]]'', ''[[Back at the Barnyard]]'', ''[[True Jackson, VP]]'', ''[[Dora The Explorer]]'' and more are airing the latest episodes. In the September 2010 issue of the [[Philippine]] magazine, [[Total Girl]], they have said on their Next Month section that they will be featuring an Article of [[Victorious]] which means that the show is going to premiere on October 8, 2010, yet it is confirmed and will have a preview on October 1, 2010. On September and October 2010, Nickelodoen Southeast Asia is expected to have new episodes/seasons [[SpongeBob SquarePants]], [[iCarly]], [[Big Time Rush]], [[True Jackson, VP]] and more. Current and upcoming Nickelodeon shows from the [[United States]] that are un-aired on Asia are expecting to premiere sometime this year or next year like ([[Avatar: The Legend of Korra]], [[Planet Sheen]], [[T.U.F.F. Puppy]], [[House of Anubis]], [[Monsters vs. Aliens]] and more). ==See also== * [[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] * [[Nickelodeon Asia]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.nick-asia.com Nickelodeon South East Asia(Main)] (in English) *[http://www.nickindia.com Nickelodeon India] (in English) *[http://www.nickjapan.com Nickelodeon Japan] (in Japanese) *[http://nick.cctv.com Nickelodeon China] (in Chinese) *[http://www.nick.co.kr Nickelodeon Korea] (in Korean) *[http://www.nickarabia.net Nickelodeon Arabia] (in Arabic) *[http://www.nickpakistan.tv/ Nickelodeon Pakistan] (in English) *[http://www.nick-asia.com/turbonick TurboNick South East Asia] * [http://www.nickelodeonphilippines.webs.com/ Nickelodeon Philippines Fansite] {{Nickelodeon}} {{MTV Networks}} {{Viacom}} {{List of Astro Channels}} [[Category:Television stations]] [[Category:Children's television networks]] [[Category:Southeast Asian media]] [[id:Nickelodeon Asia Tenggara]] [[tl:Nickelodeon (istasyong pang-telebisyon)]]
